column4: sun doesn't make one.  The bug on their tracker is several years old.  use an open java plugin like gcjwebplugin or install 32bit firefox (see !flash64)
so, any hint how to get a remote kvm java console running in browser without having sun java ? (icedtea doesn't do)
hm, I actually have flash running on an amd64 desktop *wondering*
I just know the facoid's name as !flash64, it's not specific to flash
not really, you just download the tarball, extract somewhere and copy whatever plugins you want, and create some symlinks
thats not tithin package management .. as I like to run machines over years just upgrading thats not a solution :)
there's no other way that I know of
that's not going to get updated when you upgrade either
but it is within apt at least :)
